etymology.description: Originally 𠀠 (basket) -> 丌 (added to represent a stand) = basket on stand -> ancient form of 其(qí, 'his')
etymology.interpretation: The character 丌 (jī, 'table') initially depicted a stand used for supporting a basket. This aligns with its eventual borrowing into the character 其(qí, 'his'), illustrating how components can shift from concrete objects to abstract uses.

examples.chinese: 这张丌很宽敞(這張丌很寬敞)。
工匠精心制作丌(工匠精心製作丌)，设计独具匠心(設計獨具匠心)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngjiàng jīngxīn zhìzuò jī, shèjì dújù jiàngxīn.
examples.english: The craftsman meticulously made the table, and its design is uniquely ingenious.

examples.chinese: 古董店里有一张古旧的丌(古董店裡有一張古舊的丌)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdǒngdiàn lǐ yǒu yī zhāng gǔjiù de jī.
examples.english: There is an old table in the antique shop.
